arm_group.description: active comparator: low sodium diet (80 mmol/die)

brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of the study was to verify the effects of moderate versus low sodium intake on
      pulmonary capillary wedge pressure (PCWP), determined by Doppler echocardiography and tissue
      Doppler imaging in patients suffering from compensated heart failure.

clinical_study.brief_title: Estimated Echocardiographic Pulmonary Capillary Wedge Pressure in Heart Failure

detailed_description.textblock:
the study outcome is hospital readmission and mortality after 12 months of two different
      sodium diet.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  compensated HF patients

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  decompensated HF patients

intervention.description: normal sodium diet (120 mmol/daily) for 1 year

clinical_study.official_title: Moderate Versus Low Sodium Diet Intake Effects on Estimated Echocardiographic Pulmonary Capillary Wedge Pressure During 12 Months of Follow up in Compensated Heart Failure Patients.

primary_outcome.description: every six months we measure the PCWP by echocardiography

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator), Primary Purpose: Treatment
